title: Clickjacking on profile page leading to unauthorized changes

profile.name: UPchieve
profile.about: An edtech nonprofit democratizing access to academic support in the U.S.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Any attacker could use iFrame options to connect remotely to the real website, And he can craft his own website using the iFrame options of the specific link and can lead to unauthorized changes if the user will be logged in.

## Steps To Reproduce:
1. Login to https://app.upchieve.org/profile
2. Download the attached file and run it on the same browser 
3. You will see a small window which shows us the profile page, Ive currently set the size to small
4. Attacker can make it bigger and gain info.

## Recommendations for Fixing/Mitigation
Use X-Frame Options in the HTTP Responses of the page, This will help content going straight to user and not a 3rd Party.

## Impact

Unauthorized control

activities.message: Hi, we're a team of 3 people (not security team, entire dev team) with no security experts. I'm triaging as fast as I can right now but for each report I have to read it and then often do research to understand it. Our target for triaging is 3 days because of that. Please be patient, thank you!
Thanks for reporting, we've gotten a couple of clickjacking reports, so we clearly need to do some server security work to get the right headers set. Will target this for the next couple of sprints.

Thanks for the triage,
I totally understand your situation sir, You can take your time for resolution of this report.

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

Hi,
I would really appreciate if you tell me a time period in how much time can this be resolved.
I understand your current situation and i know its hard for you to do things quickly

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik
Hi Shivansh, we're working on clickjacking and CORS issues in this sprint. I should have something out to production by tomorrow.

Hi,
Its already 10 days i've not got any response, Any updates sir? :)

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

Hi, it took a lot longer than I thought to get this done because our Content Security Policy ended up taking a lot of customization. We have added some security packages that should prevent this from occuring now. Can you please confirm using https://hackers.upchieve.org and let me know if we can resolve this? Much appreciated!

Hello,
I can confirm that this report can be changed to Resolved, I could not reproduce the bug anymore from my side.
Probably means the security packages were useful, I get a message in iFrame window: 
"To protect your security, app.upchieve.org will not allow Firefox to display the page if another site has embedded it. To see this page, you need to open it in a new window."
So, Clickjacking is no longer possible.
I have a request, If you can please upgrade the severity to high or critical because this vulnerability would be very harmful, Because any other site can embed your page, And then change the content/template to something non-malicious.

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

Hello,
Already been 2 days, Have you read my messages sir?

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

Excuse me?
Any updates?

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik
Sorry, the last few days have been incredibly busy. HackerOne isn't letting me change the severity. I'll put in a ticket with them.

Note: Please resolve this report, Then maybe youll be able to  change severity. 
ive noticed that :)

Hello,
Are there any updates on this?

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

Hello sir,
Please resolve this one, You can change the severity of the report after resolving it

Best regards,
Shivansh Malik

summaries.content: This was a simple clickjacking vulnerability on the profile page which was leading to unauthorized action.
